conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to determine the speed of the bullet relative to the ground and the distance between two adjacent bullets in the air.

premise: The bullet is fired horizontally every Δt₀ time interval. Since the speed of the bullet is constant at v₀, the distance traveled by the bullet in Δt₀ time intervals is s.
The distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is s. This distance is the horizontal distance covered by the bullet in Δt₀ time intervals.
The speed of the bullet relative to the ground is the same as the speed of the bullet relative to the ground in the previous step.
The distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is s. This distance is the horizontal distance covered by the bullet in Δt₀ time intervals.
The speed of the bullet relative to the ground is the same as the speed of the bullet relative to the ground in the previous step.
Therefore, the speed of the bullet relative to the ground is s / Δt₀, and the distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is s.
